question: List all the different temperatures that a user has cooked onions. List them with date, temp, and outcome if available.

events.outcome: caramelized onions prepared in a jar (with egg yolks and honey for hollandaise).

evidence.excerpt: first video is me putting the caramelized onions and egg yolks for a little bit of honey in a jar.

events.outcome: jar containing caramelized onions placed in a water bath.

evidence.excerpt: second video was me putting that jar in a water bath at 140 something degrees at 141°

events.outcome: onions starting to become translucent and have shrunk slightly; lid removed.

evidence.excerpt: cooking onions at 182°F, getting a bit translucent and shrinking slightly, lid now off

events.outcome: onions browned at times when cooking around 210°F.

evidence.excerpt: the onions have become much more brown at times they were cooking at about 210° but then I turned the heat down on average it’s been around 180°
but then I turned the heat down on average it’s been around 180°

events.outcome: initial low heat around 165°F; heat later increased to ~270°F.

evidence.excerpt: i’ve stepped away from the pan because it was on low and it was around and I think it was maybe around 165° so then I turned up the heat a little bit from maybe like 2 to 4 on the dial and I stepped away from the pan  and I got real hot real quick and it started to go up to like 270 or somewhere in the 270° range

events.outcome: heat spiked to ~270°F; some onions browned significantly while others remained translucent.

evidence.excerpt: turned heat up from around 165°F (dial 2 to 4), spiked to ~270°F, with some onions significantly browned and others still translucent.

events.outcome: temps around 229°F; Kerrygold butter and water added; burning slowed and heat distributed more evenly.

evidence.excerpt: i’ve added some keri gold butter and water probably about 2 tablespoons on the first round and then I just did it again I think the first round was about a half an hour ago but I’m not sure. I think it helped slow some of the burning and more evenly distributed some of the heat temperatures are still around 229° when I checked it and it could’ve been that way for up to a half an hour around then

I had I put the jar of egg and sous vide egg yolk and caramelized onion in the refrigerator overnight. This had been in a sous vide circulator at about 140.5° for maybe 4 to 5 hours. A refrigerated overnight and I’m reheating it in a sous vide bath at around 105° because I was already making some yogurt
he reduced the heat to about 136° surface on the pan

events.outcome: onion mixture warmed; briefly spiked to 150° before heat was removed and mixture integrated with eggs

evidence.excerpt: I scooped out the onion egg mixture the sous vide caramelized onion mixture after it had warmed up and I scooped it directly into the eggs after they were cooked a little bit that around and 130° range and 140° range of a pan was a little bit hot it briefly got up to what I tested it about 150° so I took it off the heat and then incorporating and stirred more of the mixture in

events.outcome: mixture thickened during cooking at 150° surface temp

evidence.excerpt: I actually let it cook at around 150° on the on the surface temperature of the pan and it actually with enough speed in motion it thickened up pretty nicely
and then I briefly took it to 180° on the surface of the pan just to give it some nice color and done ness

events.outcome: reheating of onion mixture in sous vide bath

evidence.excerpt: I had I put the jar of egg and sous vide egg yolk and caramelized onion in the refrigerator overnight. This had been in a sous vide circulator at about 140.5° for maybe 4 to 5 hours. A refrigerated overnight and I’m reheating it in a sous vide bath at around 105° because I was already making some yogurt
